definition: to stuff one's pockets/to take bribes
to stuff one's pockets/to enrich oneself dishonestly

sentences.english: Yet poor Nigerians fear that corrupt officials will pocket the savings.
sentences.chinese: 可憐的尼日利亞人害怕腐敗官員會中飽私囊。

sentences.english: They all pocket each 50 cents as windfall.
sentences.chinese: 他們都將每個50美分中飽私囊，當作意外之財。

sentences.english: The policeman lined his pockets with bribes.
sentences.chinese: 這警察接受賄賂中飽私囊。

sentences.english: They are always trying to feather their nest.
sentences.chinese: 他們總是想盡辦法中飽私囊。

sentences.english: The policeman has lined his pockets by taking bribes.
sentences.chinese: 那個警察貪贓受賄，以飽私囊。

definition: to embezzle/to misappropriate/to line one's pockets with public funds
to stuff one's pockets/to take bribes
lit. the fat and wealth of the people (idiom); the nation's hard-won wealth (esp. as an object of unscrupulous exploitation)/the people's blood, sweat and tears
to damage the public interest for personal profit (idiom); personal profit at public expense/venal and selfish behavior
state treasury, also written 帑臧[tang3 zang1]
to gain from corrupt dealing/to engage in graft/to feather one's nest
movable property/money and belongings/non-real estate assets
